alert.note: Alert for Livingston (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 18 at 9:27AM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT PARTS OF LIVINGSTON COUNTY... HAZARDS...A snow squall accompanied by winds of 20 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to a quarter of a mile or less. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 926 AM EST, a snow squall was along a line extending from near Fowlerville to near Howell to near Gregory and moving east at 25 MPH. THIS SQUALL WILL BE NEAR... Howell, Pinckney, Cohoctah and Oak Grove around 940 AM EST. Hartland, Brighton and Hamburg around 1000 AM EST. Whitmore Lake around 1005 AM EST. South Lyon around 1015 AM EST. This includes the following highways... I-96 between mile markers 125 and 152. US-23 between mile markers 54 and 77. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
